p: CHansky: And, Meredith, another aspect of that is the weight of history—that there is a history of an external agent entering my community and taking something. In many instances, that was harmful to the community. When I enter a community as a researcher, that weight is on my shoulders. I can't ask a community that I don't know, that I'm not a part of, to trust me and to trust that everything I do will be ethical and respectful and collaborative, because they don't know me. They know these hundreds of years in which people have entered their communities and taken something from them.
